avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, on steep shady slopes.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls above approximately 1800 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A little new snow above approximately 1000 m. The wind will be strong. These conditions will cause a slight rise in the danger of dry avalanches on steep shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment: Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. In particular at low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: The wind slabs are rather small and can only be released in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. Hardly any snow is lying above approximately 1600 m.
